aboutme.title: About Me
aboutme.content: I am a Python Developer with a strong passion for coding and a desire to learn new technologies. I have a solid understanding of the basics of Python programming. I am comfortable working on medium-sized projects and am able to deliver clean, efficient and well-documented code. I am highly motivated and eager to learn, and I am always looking for opportunities to improve my skills and grow as a developer. I am a team player and have great manager and communication skills which help me to work effectively with a team.

workexperience.title: Working Student
workexperience.description: At Bosch was a great experience, I have learned a lot of things and I have worked on a lot of projects.

projects.name: Refactoring internal tools
projects.description: Refactoring internal tools to make them more efficient and easier to maintain.

projects.name: Safety and Comfort functions simulator with GUI
projects.description:
We integrated one internal software that simulates the radar from a car and we integrated with and open source software that presents the car. The open source software was Esmini.
Besides integrating this two software we also created a scenario generator that parse and create new XOSC and XODR files.

projects.name: ML model for predicting the false activation of the radar
projects.description: I created a ML model that predicts the false activation of the radar. I used the data from the radar and already labeled data to train the model.

projects.name: A2L file parser
projects.description: I worked in a team of 7 people using the Agile methodology. The parser was already and we had to maintain it, add new featurea, fix bugs and improve the performance.

projects.name: Jira automation watchdog
projects.description: This project started as somthing very small but it grow a lot. First requirement was to have a json file with all filters used for finding specific tickets and add a custom comment to them. But after a while the need of adding filters and new comments for diffrent types of situations made the initial solution not suited anymore. So I split the project in three parts. The first part was the watchdog that had suffered minor changes. It shares a container with the backend that is responsible for CRUD operations between frontend and the database written in Python using FastAPI framework. The last part is a frontend written in react that is used to add new filters and comments. After the bot was functional I had to host it somewhere. For that I used an Ubuntu server here i used docker to deply it and configured a nginx server to redirect the traffic to the bot.

freelancing.short-description: As a freelancer I worked on many types of projects

projects.name: Automatic PDF to CSV converter
projects.description: I created a script that converts a PDF file to a CSV file. The script is able to read the PDF file and extract the data from it and convert to a CSV file.

projects.name: Python Logic Puzzles script
projects.description: The script solves logic puzzles, mainly mathematical logic puzzles.

projects.name: Load-balancer and Keepalived configuration
projects.description: I configured a load-balancer and Keepalived for a client. The client had two servers and wanted to balance the traffic between them.

projects.name: Django Rest API
projects.description: I created a Django Rest API for a client. The API was used to store and retrieve data from a database.

projects.name: Fulfilment center automation
projects.description: This was my biggest client, I hand to do a lot of things for them, Google Sheets Automation in JS was how it all started, then it started to be a big responsibility for me because i started to work with the database of the warehouse and also with orders and shipments. My main responsability was to move all the data from a management software to another by using API endpoints only. In order to do that I had to map the endpoints and validate the data before sending it to the new software. After this was done nex thing was to create a script that fetches all the shipment labels and sent them to a specific email. After 100+ hours of work for them, sadly the project come to an end. I learned a lot about APIs and their arhitecture.
